section.title: Input
section.para: During the test case execution it might be required to read some user input. Therefore the framework offers the input action. The test execution will stop and wait for user keyboard input over the standard input stream. The user has to type the input and end with return key.
The inputted string will be stored to the respective variable value.
section.programlisting:
<testcase name="inputTest"> <variables> <variable name="userinput" value=""></variable> <variable name="userinput1" value=""></variable> <variable name="userinput2" value="y"></variable> <variable name="userinput3" value="yes"></variable> <variable name="userinput4" value=""></variable> </variables> <actions> <input/> <echo><message>user input was: ${userinput}</message></echo>
<input message="Now press enter:" variable="userinput1"/> <echo><message>user input was: ${userinput1}</message></echo>
<input message="Do you want to continue?" validAnswers="y/n" variable="userinput2"/> <echo><message>user input was: ${userinput2}</message></echo>
<input message="Do you want to continue?" validAnswers="yes/no" variable="userinput3"/> <echo><message>user input was: ${userinput3}</message></echo>
<input variable="userinput4"/> <echo><message>user input was: ${userinput4}</message></echo> </actions> </testcase>
section.para: The input action will have following attributes:

listitem.para: message -> message to display to the user
validAnswers -> optional slash separated string containing the possible answers
variable -> destination variable to store the user input (default = ${userinput})
